title: Andy Murray's experience shines through with European Open first round win
text:
Andy Murray scored his first ATP singles victory on European soil for 16 months on Tuesday night: a slightly scratchy 6-4, 7-6 win over local wildcard Kimmer Coppejans.

Murray had to deal with a few glitches on his serve – including three double-faults in a single game – but his greater experience carried him through in 1hr 44min.

A slow court speed made for a very different feeling to last week's fast conditions in Shanghai, where Murray had come to the net frequently.

Here he hung back and was often made to scramble in defence by Coppejans, who struck the ball well for a man ranked No. 158. But there were also enough freebie errors coming his way to keep the comeback train on its tracks.

Murray converted his first match point with a signature play, using a couple of neatly-judged lobs to make the increasingly nervy Coppejans play difficult overheads. “I would have liked to have served a bit better,” he said afterwards, “but I think I did well.”
description: Andy Murray scored his first ATP singles victory on European soil for 16 months on Tuesday night:
